biogHist.p: The King's College is a Christian liberal arts institution for post-secondary education. It is not affiliated with a specific denomination, but is maintained by the The King's College corporation whose six thousand members are associated with various denominations. The College has described its educational philosophy in a statement of educational principles and objectives. The College, enabled by The King's College Act 1979, offers courses in the arts, sciences, education, and theology; it serves students from throughout Alberta, five other provinces, and two foreign countries (Present and Future Roles of The King's College, 1982). Presidents: 1978-1983 Sidney C.G. DeWaal; 1983-1985 S. Keith Ward (Acting); 1985- Henk W.H. Van Andel.
